Explanations about Options.-l(C): In contrast, after "passwd -l root", you cannot login as root using password[1].
Explanations about Options.-l(M):
Lock the password of the named account. This option disables a password by changing it
 to a value which matches no possible encrypted value (it adds a ´!´ at the beginning
 of the password).

Explanations about Options.--encrypt(C): The command goes something like, .  "zip --encrypt foo.zip foo.txt" which asks for password on terminal,.
Explanations about Options.--encrypt(M):
Encrypt the contents of the zip archive using a password which is entered on the
 terminal in response to a prompt (this will not be echoed; if standard error is not
 a tty, zip will exit with an error). The password prompt is repeated to save the
 user from typing errors.
Explanations about Options.-e(M):

Explanations about Options.-G(M):
GROUP1[,GROUP2,...[,GROUPN]]]
 A list of supplementary groups which the user is also a member of. Each group is
 separated from the next by a comma, with no intervening whitespace. The groups are
 subject to the same restrictions as the group given with the -g option.
Explanations about Options.-m(M): Move the content of the user's home directory to the new location.
